text: Both SigK and GerE were essential for ykvP expression, and this gene was transcribed from T5 of sporulation.

text: Our results indicate that the level of KatX level in outgrowing spores depends mainly on EsigmaF, because sigB mutants show normal KatX activity in dormant and outgrowing spores.

text: The ald promoter, like the sigE promoter, is believed to be recognized by sigmaA RNA polymerase, suggesting that sigmaK may inhibit sigmaA activity late in sporulation.

text: The ald promoter, like the sigE promoter, is believed to be recognized by sigmaA RNA polymerase, suggesting that sigmaK may inhibit sigmaA activity late in sporulation.

text: The SpoIIE phosphatase indirectly activates sigmaF by dephosphorylating a protein (SpoIIAA-P) in the pathway that controls the activity of the transcription factor.
text_with_entity_marker: The [E1]SpoIIE[/E1] phosphatase indirectly activates sigmaF by dephosphorylating a protein ([E2]SpoIIAA-P[/E2]) in the pathway that controls the activity of the transcription factor.

text: Dephosphorylation of SpoIIAA-P by SpoIIE is strictly dependent on the presence of the bivalent metal ions Mn2+ or Mg2+.
text_with_entity_marker: Dephosphorylation of [E1]SpoIIAA-P[/E1] by [E2]SpoIIE[/E2] is strictly dependent on the presence of the bivalent metal ions Mn2+ or Mg2+.

text: Three new sigmaB-dependent genes (ydaE, ydaG and yfkM) encoding proteins with still unknown functions were also described.

text: These results demonstrate that sigmaK-dependent transcription of gerE initiates a negative feedback loop in which GerE acts as a repressor to limit production of sigmaK.
text_with_entity_marker: These results demonstrate that [E1]sigmaK[/E1]-dependent transcription of [E2]gerE[/E2] initiates a negative feedback loop in which GerE acts as a repressor to limit production of sigmaK.

text: ComK negatively controls the transcription of hag by stimulating the transcription of comF-flgM, thereby increasing the production of the FlgM antisigma factor that inhibits sigmaD activity.

text: sigma X also contributes to the expression of CsbB, a putative membrane-bound glucosyl transferase that is partially controlled by the sigma B stress response sigma factor.

text: Furthermore, YtxH and YvyD seemed to be induced after phosphate starvation in the wild type in a sigma(B)-dependent manner and in the sigB mutant probably via sigma(H).

text: Transcription of the cotB, cotC, and cotX genes by final sigma(K) RNA polymerase is activated by a small, DNA-binding protein called GerE.

text: We overproduced and purified sigma(X) from Escherichia coli and demonstrate that in vitro, both sigma(A) and sigma(X) holoenzymes recognize promoter elements within the sigX-ypuN control region.
text_with_entity_marker: We overproduced and purified sigma(X) from Escherichia coli and demonstrate that in vitro, both [E1]sigma(A)[/E1] and sigma(X) holoenzymes recognize promoter elements within the sigX-[E2]ypuN[/E2] control region.

text: We overproduced and purified sigma(X) from Escherichia coli and demonstrate that in vitro, both sigma(A) and sigma(X) holoenzymes recognize promoter elements within the sigX-ypuN control region.

text: Our data demonstrate that the CtsR protein acts as a global repressor of the clpC operon, as well as other class III heat shock genes, by preventing unstressed transcription from either the sigmaB- or sigmaA-dependent promoter and might be inactivated or dissociate under inducing stress conditions.
text_with_entity_marker: Our data demonstrate that the [E1]CtsR[/E1] protein acts as a global repressor of the clpC operon, as well as other class III heat shock genes, by preventing unstressed transcription from either the sigmaB- or [E2]sigmaA[/E2]-dependent promoter and might be inactivated or dissociate under inducing stress conditions.

text: The sigmaB-dependent promoter drives expression of yvyD under stress conditions and after glucose starvation, whereas a sigmaH-dependent promoter is responsible for yvyD transcription following amino acid limitation.
text_with_entity_marker: The sigmaB-dependent promoter drives expression of [E1]yvyD[/E1] under stress conditions and after glucose starvation, whereas a [E2]sigmaH[/E2]-dependent promoter is responsible for yvyD transcription following amino acid limitation.

text: This indicates that the yvyD gene product, being a member of both the sigmaB and sigmaH regulons, might negatively regulate the activity of the sigmaL regulon.
text_with_entity_marker: This indicates that the yvyD gene product, being a member of both the [E1]sigmaB[/E1] and [E2]sigmaH[/E2] regulons, might negatively regulate the activity of the sigmaL regulon.

text: The class includes AsiA form bacteriophage T4, which inhibits Escherichia coli sigma 70; FlgM, present in both gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria, which inhibits the flagella sigma factor sigma 28; SpoIIAB, which inhibits the sporulation-specific sigma factor, sigma F and sigma G, of Bacillus subtilis; RbsW of B. subtilis, which inhibits stress response sigma factor sigma B; and DnaK, a general regulator of the heat shock response, which in bacteria inhibits the heat shock sigma factor sigma 32.

text: The sigma W regulon includes a penicillin binding protein (PBP4*) and a co-transcribed amino acid racemase (RacX), homologues of signal peptide peptidase (YteI), flotillin (YuaG), ABC transporters (YknXYZ), non-haem bromoperoxidase (YdjP), epoxide hydrolase (YfhM) and three small peptides with structural similarities to bacteriocin precursor polypeptides.
